body: Agreed about `connections`, haven't looked at the others yet. I don't see any reason to avoid dictionaries in general (they are useful), but we should not mix random keys like device ID:s with known keys like "total" in the same dict.
Ideally we do whatever tweaks we want to do this week, before releasing the updated REST stuff into the wild.

Thanks for the hint! I'm doing 

```
var result = JsonConvert.DeserializeObject<Dictionary<string, ItemConnectionData>>(response.Content);
```

now and just filtering by key. Just workarounds though :) Did not make much progress on a possible transformation of the REST APIs, Go is not to be learned on a single day.
That's probably a neater way of doing it, to be honest!

repository.name: SyncTrayzor
repository.description: Windows tray utility / filesystem watcher / launcher for Syncthing

issue.title: REST API: Improve JSON response for /system/connections

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I'm currently developing a Nagios/Icinga check to monitor syncthing and it's connections. I use the built in REST API of syncthing to gather the needed information.
According to the docs under http://docs.syncthing.net/rest/system-connections-get.html a sample response is:

``` json
{
   "total" : {
          "paused" : false,
          "clientVersion" : "",
          "at" : "2015-11-07T17:29:47.691637262+01:00",
          "connected" : false,
          "inBytesTotal" : 1479,
          "type" : "direct-accept",
          "outBytesTotal" : 1318,
          "address" : ""
   },
   "connections" : {
          "YZJBJFX-RDBL7WY-6ZGKJ2D-4MJB4E7-ZATSDUY-LD6Y3L3-MLFUYWE-AEMXJAC" : {
             "connected" : true,
             "inBytesTotal" : 556,
             "paused" : false,
             "at" : "2015-11-07T17:29:47.691548971+01:00",
             "clientVersion" : "v0.12.1",
             "address" : "127.0.0.1:22002",
             "type" : "direct-dial",
             "outBytesTotal" : 550
          },
          "DOVII4U-SQEEESM-VZ2CVTC-CJM4YN5-QNV7DCU-5U3ASRL-YVFG6TH-W5DV5AA" : {
             "outBytesTotal" : 0,
             "type" : "direct-accept",
             "address" : "",
             "at" : "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
             "clientVersion" : "",
             "paused" : false,
             "inBytesTotal" : 0,
             "connected" : false
          },
          "UYGDMA4-TPHOFO5-2VQYDCC-7CWX7XW-INZINQT-LE4B42N-4JUZTSM-IWCSXA4" : {
             "address" : "",
             "type" : "direct-accept",
             "outBytesTotal" : 0,
             "connected" : false,
             "inBytesTotal" : 0,
             "paused" : false,
             "at" : "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
             "clientVersion" : ""
          }
   }
}
```

I would like to see an improvement of the response by using an array containing every connection. For example:

``` json
{
   "total" : {
          "paused" : false,
          "clientVersion" : "",
          "at" : "2015-11-07T17:29:47.691637262+01:00",
          "connected" : false,
          "inBytesTotal" : 1479,
          "type" : "direct-accept",
          "outBytesTotal" : 1318,
          "address" : ""
   },
   "connections" : [
           {
             "id": "YZJBJFX-RDBL7WY-6ZGKJ2D-4MJB4E7-ZATSDUY-LD6Y3L3-MLFUYWE-AEMXJAC",
             "connected" : true,
             "inBytesTotal" : 556,
             "paused" : false,
             "at" : "2015-11-07T17:29:47.691548971+01:00",
             "clientVersion" : "v0.12.1",
             "address" : "127.0.0.1:22002",
             "type" : "direct-dial",
             "outBytesTotal" : 550
          },
          {
            "id": "DOVII4U-SQEEESM-VZ2CVTC-CJM4YN5-QNV7DCU-5U3ASRL-YVFG6TH-W5DV5AA",
             "outBytesTotal" : 0,
             "type" : "direct-accept",
             "address" : "",
             "at" : "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
             "clientVersion" : "",
             "paused" : false,
             "inBytesTotal" : 0,
             "connected" : false
          },
          {
             "id": "UYGDMA4-TPHOFO5-2VQYDCC-7CWX7XW-INZINQT-LE4B42N-4JUZTSM-IWCSXA4",
             "address" : "",
             "type" : "direct-accept",
             "outBytesTotal" : 0,
             "connected" : false,
             "inBytesTotal" : 0,
             "paused" : false,
             "at" : "0001-01-01T00:00:00Z",
             "clientVersion" : ""
          }
   ]
}
```

The current response is not a RFC violation.
